original: Linden, Oscar, civiHngenjör, Borås, f. 18/2/83 i Jarlsbergs amt, Norge, av sv. föräldr. förvalt. August Leonard L. o. Emilia Olsson. G. 18 m. Ester Norén. Barn: Elsa f. 19 fil. mag., g. m. civiling. Gunnar Hambræus, Gunnar f. 22, civiling., Erik f. 28. — Civiling :ex. v. KTH (E) 11. Konstr. o. tekn. chef f. kraftavd. v. Elektr. A-B Chr. Bergh & Co. i Malmö 11-15, lär. v. navig:-skolans i Malmö maskinistavd :ar 12-15, v. Malmö tekn. yrkessk. 14-15, e. o. lektor v. Örebro tekn. elem:sk. (numera tekn. gymn.) 15-17, distr :ing. o. chef f. vattenf :styr. Upps :drstr. 17-19, verkst. dir. o. tekn. chef f. Vis-kans Kraft A-B o. Viskans regler :-fören. i Borås sed. 19. Förest, f. Borås rundradiostat. o. led. av dess styr. sed. 26. Led. av styr. f. Viskans Kraft A-B sed. 19, f. Viskans regler :fören. u. p. a. sed. 33, ordf. i Borås radioklubb 24-26, led. av Borås stadsrev. sed. 28, dess v. ordf. samt ordf. i dess andra avd. 35-36, ordf. i samfällda stadsrev. 36-39. Medl. av Sv. tekn:- fören., Borås tekn. förb., Frim:orden, Odd Fellow, Rotaryklubben, Human, förb. Skr.: Kortfattad handledn. i elektrotekn. grundbegrepp (20), Konstgjord belysning (25), Viskan o. dess kraftverk (45) samt ett flert. art. i oili-ka publ. Kommerskolieg. stip. i USA 27. RVO, PatrstGM.
translated: Linden, Oscar, civilian engineer, Borås, born on 18/2/83 in Jarlsbergs county, Norway, to Swedish parents, manager August Leonard L. and Emilia Olsson. Married in 18 to Ester Norén. Children: Elsa, born in 19, Master of Arts, married to civil engineer Gunnar Hambræus; Gunnar, born in 22, civil engineer; Erik, born in 28. Completed civil engineering studies at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 11. Worked as a construction and technical manager for the power department at Elektr. A-B Chr. Bergh & Co. in Malmö from 11 to 15. Was a teacher at the navigation school in Malmö for the machine department from 12 to 15, at Malmö Technical Vocational School from 14 to 15, and an acting lecturer at Örebro Technical Elementary School (now Technical Gymnasium) from 15 to 17. Was a district engineer and head of water control in Uppsala County from 17 to 19. Became managing director and technical manager for Vis-kans Kraft A-B and Viskans regleringför-en. in Borås since 19. Was the head of Borås radio station and a member of its board since 26. Member of the board of Viskans Kraft A-B since 19, and Viskans regleringför-en. until 33. Was the chairman of Borås Radio Club from 24 to 26, a member of Borås city audit committee since 28, its vice chairman, and chairman of its second department from 35 to 36. Chairman of joint city audit committee from 36 to 39. Member of Swedish Technical Association, Borås Technical Association, Freemasonry Order, Odd Fellow, Rotary Club, and Human Labour Association. Author of "Concise Manual on Basic Electrical Engineering Principles" (20), "Artificial Lighting" (25), "Viskan and its Power Plants" (45), as well as several articles in various publications. Received a scholarship from the Commercial College in the USA in 27. Awarded Royal Victorian Order and Patriotic Gold Medal.

employmentHistory.roleName: District Engineer and Head of Water Control
